summary: The diff adds a Valentine-themed single-page UI with Yes/No interaction logic and themed styling, but it also introduces Internet Identity/auth-related code (not requested) and does not provide evidence that the required generated image file was added under the specified public assets path. Some REQ-1 details (exact prompt text / exactly two buttons) cannot be fully verified due to truncation of App.tsx.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the required generated image(s) to the frontend as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and reference them directly from the UI (do not serve images via the backend).
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references `/assets/generated/valentine-yes-meme.dim_1024x1024.png`, but the diff summary does not show any new file added under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (only LLM-readable files are listed, and no asset file addition is evidenced).
evidence: File diff summary ADDED FILES list (no `frontend/public/assets/generated/...` entry shown)

missing_requirements.requirement: Create a single, mobile-friendly interactive page whose only purpose is to ask: "Mr. Bingus, will you be my Valentine?" and present exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".
missing_requirements.reason: App.tsx is truncated before the initial (unanswered) view is fully visible, so the exact on-screen prompt text and confirmation of exactly two actionable buttons cannot be verified from the provided diff summary.
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (truncated before the initial view content showing the prompt and buttons)

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication and identity-aware actor creation/query invalidation via React Query.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly disallows third-party auth/external services and does not request any authentication. The diff adds Internet Identity provider, AuthClient usage, and actor creation logic.
The BuildRequest states the experience can be fully client-side and lists implementing a backend canister feature as a non-goal; no backend changes are requested.
